intro: Celmisia viscosa, commonly known as the sticky celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
